alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 11:26AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sheridan County through 1215 PM MDT... At 1124 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Saddlestring, or 19 miles south of Sheridan, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Watch for ponding of water on the roads. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Big Horn, Story and Banner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
